intro: Diplazium japonicum var. yaoshanense, commonly known as the Yaoshan sword fern, is a variant of the Japanese spleenwort fern. It is characterized by its finely divided, linear fronds that are typically 30–60 cm in length. The plant produces sporangia on the underside of its fertile fronds, which are clustered in sori. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, often found in forest understories. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
